pr_title: Replace java.lang.Compiler.command usage with proper native-image API methods

timeline.message: Provide replacement for CompilerCommandPlugin based ArgumentVector functions

Revert "Remove obsolete CompilerCommandPlugin infrastructure"

This reverts commit 740a43e8a1893c1064f67391b3584699390daa27.

Once all use of this undocumented interface is removed everywhere this
commit can be reverted thus finally the obsolete CompilerCommandPlugin
infrastructure will be gone.
Throw UnsupportedOperationException if argument-vector methods are called from shared library image
Provide HeapDumpSupport and use same signature as in HotSpotDiagnosticMXBean
Explicitly exclude non-posix platforms from argument vector support
Import IOException instead of using java.io.IOException
Make getArgumentVectorBlockSize() usable for argument vector support checking

timeline.bodyText: I don't like catching exceptions as normal control flow (and on Windows this is normal control flow). Better would be to make the check method return a boolean and in the callers either return -1 or throw an exception.
timeline.author: christianwimmer

replies.bodyText: Will do that in the follow up PR (where I remove the CompilerCommandPlugin stuff). The reason I didn't do that was to keep separate UnsupportedOperationException message strings ("Argument vector not accessible (called from shared library image?)" vs. "Argument vector manipulation unsupported for platform " + ...).
replies.author: olpaw
